 comment_text | "

Also I had nothing to do in this war:

 Byron Wilcott and David Otunga were removed and then readded to the list five times.

 Dos Caras, Jr. was removed and then readded to the list seven times.

 Jason Riggs and Johnny Riggs were removed and then readded to the list four times.

 Glamarella was added and then removed from the list three times.

 Matt Walsh and Mike Hutter were added and then removed from the list three times.

 Chad Lail was added and then removed from the list three times.

Probably the third?

Anyway, everyone edited, more or less it matters not, all that matters is were we are and it's all our falt. WE have done this and we'll get out of it. Please don't treat me like a vandal or anything. I participated, and I don't see it fair that you say four editors were in the war, it was well more. jan 

It was stated above that while other editors were making edits to the page those edits were not what contributed to the conflict that caused the page to be protected. And regarding your issues with Elkman and your block, I don't see an issue there. Tiptoey blocked you and Nikki311 (upon your request) evaluated your block and found it justified.  Matt 

I'm moving the discussion  so that other contributors can edit in peace (Matt, your comment  please). jan 

You're suggesting that you move the discussion regarding this article off of the articles talkpage?  Matt 

Yes because as you see this thing is getting heated up, it would cause a bad impression. jan 

Definitely not. Discussion goes HERE, this is the talkpage, not a page is your userpage.   

Oh god there are more rules here than in Naziland (Germany in WWII). Anyway, lets see, let's reach a consensus here. Now, we unblock the page, and if a user fires up a war, let he be blocked, not the page. My issues with Elkman started in april and it was all a mistake (Contact me Elkman). Let's say that almost everyone warred, that's that, and reach the consensus I suggested. jan 

And the thread is Godwinned. Anyway, the policy is not for an immediate ban. An editor is to be warned and a ban may result if the editor in question does not stop the behavior they received the warning for.  Matt 

Yah, but they weren't even warned, just because I vandalized a page about 8M ago it dosen't mean I can't turn a new leaf. jan 

You were warned for your edits repeatedly and disregarded them. Some of the edits done were good faith reversions, which while violating 3RR may not warrant warnings if it's to revert vandalism.  comment_text | "

 Vandalism 

Someone added ""i like big butts and i cannot lie"" and I don't know how to remove it.  It's under ""Anchor career.""  FYI.

Some other sick minded person had actually deleted everything and replaced the entire article with ""hi"". seriously. what kind of person would do that?

It could be the same person. At least the page can be reverted back to its previous format, right? - Jitterro

More random vandalisms. Luckily, it gets remedied quickly, but it makes you think what sick and evil people want to lible a person. -zen

 Bias 

Please stop deleteing the MRC link and reference. They are valid and true facts.  03:03, 24 Aug 2004 (UTC)

MRC link restored by me today.  15:28, 26 Aug 2004 (UTC)

 Picture 

Taking a picture from a website does not guarantee fair use; if anything, you're not crediting the agency/photographer it came from, making it a possible copyvio. I'm placing the picture here until discussion can be raised.  11:42, Apr 27, 2005 (UTC)

You're right but this one is a promotional photo, I think it counts.  

 Death 

It's being reported that Peter Jennings died tonight. Should the article be updated now, or pending confirmation?  

Confirmed by ABC News.  

May he rest in peace.  23:54, August 8, 2005 (UTC)

I'm currently watching (live) ""World News Tonight With Peter Jennings"" yet he died two days ago. Why is that?

Charles Gibson noted, near the end of the Monday cast, that it would remain ""World News Tonight with Peter Jennings"" for the forseeable future; possibly until they've named a replacement, which will be a while. 

 ""Current event"" template 

I see no reason for it to be removed, especially since it has just been reported.  04:06, August 8, 2005 (UTC)

I uploaded a new version of the same promo image from http://abcnews.go.com/WNT/story?id=126542.  (Talk) 

 Copyright violation 

There's a paragraph in the ""Anchor Career"" section that is nearly a word-for-word copy from this NYTimes article. Can we simply re-word it or should it be stricken?  18:53, August 8, 2005 (UTC)

 Start of anchor stint 

Consistent with this article, from the NYT archives, I am changing all references to Jennings' solo anchor duties to beginning on August 9, 1983.  
 

 Chuck Jones death 

But, the only thing Peter Jennings did not do was to report the death of the animator, Chuck Jones in 2002 by ignoring the report.  Does anyone know about this?

 What? 

""Preceded by:
new show""
I have no idea what this means, does anyone, it looks odd 

It means, there wasn't a CTV National News before then.   

Doesn't make sense

The article says:
""Jennings also attended Carleton University, University of Ottawa, and Rider College in New Jersey. He never graduated from high school or college.""

How is that possible? He attended universities but never graduated Highschool..

Trust me, as someone with a chequered educational career, I can affirm that it is possible to get into college without a diploma. Many post secondary institutions have 'special student' part time or night school programs with relaxed entrance requirements. Of course, it helps that his dad was a bigwig at the CBC.  

I am an alumni of Carleton, until recently,  if one was out of school for a couple of years you could sign up as a ""special Student"" and if you did well in a couple of courses, you could then apply as a ""Mature Student"" with no consideration of your previous education required.

The curse of dimensionality

Why is that?

LDA¶

LDA

In [47]:
from pyspark.ml.clustering import LDA
In [48]:
lda = LDA(featuresCol="word_vector", seed=5757, k=7)

lda_model = lda.fit(preprocessed_dataset)

:

  • ,
  • CountVectorizer ->
  • , LDA 20_000 7
  • LogisticRegr Gradient Boosting
In [49]:
topics = lda_model.transform(preprocessed_dataset)
In [50]:
topics.show(5, vertical=True, truncate=False)

-RECORD 3------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 id                | 438e69256e644081                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
 comment_text      | B1/B2 

Is there a reason you redirected the article on invitation letters to B1/B2 visas? Although it is in regard to that visa type, no where in the redirect page does it address the how to of the letterwhat goes into it, etc. Furthermore, I had the Consular Section of the US Embassy read before I posted it to verify accuracy. The purpose was to help people understand and clarify what they needed to include in such letters and your redirect does them a disservice.

Clustering is a good dimensionality reduction technique¶

In [60]:
topics
Out[60]:
DataFrame[id: string, comment_text: string, toxic: int, severe_toxic: int, obscene: int, threat: int, insult: int, identity_hate: int, words: array<string>, words_filtered: array<string>, word_vector: vector, topicDistribution: vector]
In [61]:
from pyspark.sql import functions as f
from pyspark.ml.classification import LogisticRegression
from pyspark.ml.evaluation import BinaryClassificationEvaluator
In [62]:
target = f.when(
    (topics.toxic == 0) &
    (topics.severe_toxic == 0) &
    (topics.obscene == 0) &
    (topics.threat == 0) &
    (topics.insult == 0) &
    (topics.identity_hate == 0),
    0
).otherwise(1)
In [63]:
new_dataset = topics.withColumn("target", target)[["id", "target", "topicDistribution"]].cache()
In [64]:
new_dataset.take(5)
Out[64]:
[Row(id='85e4f353ca4b2bde', target=0, topicDistribution=DenseVector([0.0021, 0.0021, 0.7852, 0.0022, 0.2034, 0.0029, 0.0021])),

 Row(id='01c0ae884d69319b', target=0, topicDistribution=DenseVector([0.016, 0.016, 0.8954, 0.0169, 0.017, 0.0222, 0.0165])),
 Row(id='438e69256e644081', target=0, topicDistribution=DenseVector([0.0032, 0.0032, 0.4473, 0.0033, 0.0034, 0.4838, 0.0559])),

In [65]:
lr = LogisticRegression(featuresCol="topicDistribution", labelCol="target")
In [66]:
train = new_dataset.sampleBy("target", fractions={0: 0.8, 1: 0.8}, seed=5757).cache()
In [67]:
test = new_dataset.join(train, on="id", how="leftanti").coalesce(10).cache()
In [68]:
lr_model = lr.fit(train)
In [69]:
predictions = lr_model.transform(test)
In [70]:
evaluator = BinaryClassificationEvaluator(rawPredictionCol="probability", 
                                          labelCol="target", 
                                          metricName='areaUnderROC')
In [71]:
evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
Out[71]:
0.8361773017528845
In [73]:
spark.stop()

ALS¶

In [74]:
import os
import sys
os.environ["PYSPARK_SUBMIT_ARGS"]='--num-executors 5 --executor-memory 4g --driver-memory 3g pyspark-shell'
os.environ["PYSPARK_PYTHON"]='/opt/anaconda/envs/bd9/bin/python'
os.environ["SPARK_HOME"]='/usr/hdp/current/spark2-client'

spark_home = os.environ.get('SPARK_HOME', None)
if not spark_home:
    raise ValueError('SPARK_HOME environment variable is not set')
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python'))
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python/lib/py4j-0.10.7-src.zip'))
In [75]:
from pyspark import SparkConf
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

conf = SparkConf()
conf.set("spark.app.name", "app") 

spark = SparkSession.builder.config(conf=conf).getOrCreate()
In [76]:
spark
Out[76]:

SparkSession - in-memory

SparkContext

Spark UI

Version
v2.4.7
Master
yarn
AppName
app

Наша цель представить матрицу user-item ratings как произведение двух матриц меньшего ранга¶

$$R = U \times P^\top $$¶

где¶

$$U \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times k}, k \ll n$$¶

и¶

$$P \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times k}, k \ll m$$¶

Как найти решение? Оптимизировать следующий функционал:¶

$$J = \|R - U \times P^\top\|_2 + \lambda(\|U\|_2 + \|P\|_2)$$¶

Возникают 2 проблемы:¶

  • - $n \times k + m \times k$
  • non-convex (https://www.quora.com/Why-is-the-matrix-factorization-optimization-function-in-recommender-systems-not-convex)

Что же делать? ALS (alternating least squares)¶

обычный Least Squares¶

$$J(\beta) = \|y - X\beta\|_2$$¶

$$\beta = (X^\top X)^{-1}X^\top y$$¶

ALS это 2-х шаговый итеративный процесс¶

$$ \forall u_i : J(u_i) = \|R_i - u_i \times P^\top\|_2 + \lambda\|u_i\|_2$$¶

$$ \forall p_j : J(p_j) = \|R_i - U \times p^{\top}_{j}\|_2 + \lambda\|p_j\|_2$$¶

Решение следующее¶

$$u_i = (P^\top \times P + \lambda I)^{-1} \times P^\top \times R_i$$¶

$$p_j = (U^\top \times U + \lambda I)^{-1} \times U^\top \times R_j$$¶

In [77]:
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, IntegerType, LongType
from pyspark.ml.recommendation import ALS
from pyspark.ml.evaluation import RegressionEvaluator
import pyspark.sql.functions as f
In [78]:
schema = StructType([
    StructField("user", IntegerType()),
    StructField("item", IntegerType()),
    StructField("rating", IntegerType()),
    StructField("timestamp", LongType())
])
In [79]:
dataset = spark.read.csv("/lectures/lecture02/data/ml-100k/ua.base", 
                         sep="\t", 
                         schema=schema).drop("timestamp").repartition(20).cache()
In [80]:
dataset.show(5)

+----+----+------+
|user|item|rating|
+----+----+------+
| 297|   1|     3|
| 119| 924|     4|
| 373| 230|     4|
| 900| 508|     3|
|  13| 828|     1|
+----+----+------+
only showing top 5 rows
In [81]:
dataset.rdd.getNumPartitions()
Out[81]:
20
In [82]:
als = ALS(rank=10, maxIter=5, seed=5757)
In [83]:
model = als.fit(dataset)
In [84]:
model.rank
Out[84]:
10
In [85]:
test = spark.read.csv("/lectures/lecture02/data/ml-100k/ua.test", 
                      sep="\t", 
                      schema=schema).drop("timestamp").repartition(4).cache()
In [86]:
predictions = model.transform(test)
predictions
Out[86]:

Что делать с cold start в Spark?!¶

In [99]:
model = als.fit(dataset, params={als.coldStartStrategy: "drop"})
In [100]:
model.getOrDefault("coldStartStrategy")
Out[100]:
'drop'
In [101]:
predictions = model.transform(test)
In [102]:
evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
Out[102]:
0.9590533627741923

Можем ли мы лучше?¶

In [103]:
model = als.fit(dataset, params={als.coldStartStrategy: "drop", als.maxIter: 20})
In [104]:
predictions = model.transform(test)
In [105]:
evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
Out[105]:
0.9558872242636991

А еще лучше?¶

In [106]:
model = als.fit(dataset, params={als.coldStartStrategy: "drop", als.maxIter: 20, als.rank: 100})
In [107]:
predictions = model.transform(test)
In [108]:
evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
Out[108]:
0.9475039684939921

Lecture 5. ML Practical Part¶

Функции First-Class Objects¶

In [1]:
def salut(name):
    return f", {name}!"

def put_name(greeter_func):
    return greeter_func("")
In [2]:
put_name(salut)
Out[2]:
', !'
In [3]:
def parent(num):
    def first_child():
        return ",  ."

    def second_child():
        return "  ."

    if num == 1:
        return first_child
    else:
        return second_child

parent(1)
Out[3]:
<function __main__.parent.<locals>.first_child()>
In [4]:
parent(1)()
Out[4]:
',  .'

Декораторы¶

A decorator is a function that takes another function and extends the behavior of the latter function without explicitly modifying it.

In [5]:
def my_decorator(func):
    
    def wrapper():
        print("-    .")
        func()
        print("-    .")
        
    return wrapper

def say_piu():
    print("!")

say_piu = my_decorator(say_piu)
In [6]:
say_piu
Out[6]:
<function __main__.my_decorator.<locals>.wrapper()>
In [7]:
say_piu()

-    .
!
-    .
In [8]:
@my_decorator
def say_piu():
    print("!")
In [9]:
say_piu()

-    .
!
-    .

Декораторы для функций с аргументами¶

In [10]:
def do_twice(func):
    
    def wrapper_do_twice():
        func()
        func()
        
    return wrapper_do_twice
In [11]:
@do_twice
def greet(name):
    print(f"Hello {name}")
In [12]:
greet('Sergey')

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-12-c0597b66c1c1> in <module>()
----> 1 greet('Sergey')

TypeError: wrapper_do_twice() takes 0 positional arguments but 1 was given
In [13]:
def do_twice(func):
    def wrapper_do_twice(*args, **kwargs):
        func(*args, **kwargs)
        func(*args, **kwargs)
    return wrapper_do_twice

@do_twice
def greet(name):
    print(f"Hello {name}")
In [14]:
greet('Sergey')

Hello Sergey
Hello Sergey

In [15]:
import os
import sys
os.environ["PYSPARK_SUBMIT_ARGS"]='--num-executors 3 pyspark-shell'
os.environ["PYSPARK_PYTHON"]='/opt/anaconda/envs/bd9/bin/python'
os.environ["SPARK_HOME"]='/usr/hdp/current/spark2-client'

spark_home = os.environ.get('SPARK_HOME', None)
if not spark_home:
    raise ValueError('SPARK_HOME environment variable is not set')
    
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python'))
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python/lib/py4j-0.10.7-src.zip'))

UDF функции¶

In [80]:
from pyspark.sql.functions import udf

def plus_one(s):
      return s + 1
    
            # python ,   
plus_one_udf = udf(plus_one, LongType())

df.select("id", plus_one_udf("id").alias("plus_one")).show(5)

+---+--------+
| id|plus_one|
+---+--------+
|  0|       1|
|  1|       2|
|  2|       3|
|  3|       4|
|  4|       5|
+---+--------+
only showing top 5 rows

Pandas UDF¶

  • -
  • pd.Series / pd.DataFrame

+

  • - -
  • out of memory
In [81]:
import pandas as pd

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, pandas_udf, PandasUDFType
from pyspark.sql.types import LongType, DoubleType

def plus_one(s):
      return s + 1

x = pd.Series(range(10000))


print(x.head())
print()

print(plus_one(x)[:5, ])

0    0
1    1
2    2
3    3
4    4
dtype: int64

0    1
1    2
2    3
3    4
4    5
dtype: int64
In [82]:
                             # python func
plus_one_pandas_udf = pandas_udf(plus_one,
                                 #   
                                 returnType=LongType(), 
                                 # ,    pd.Series
                                 functionType=PandasUDFType.SCALAR)
In [83]:
df.select("id", plus_one_pandas_udf("id").alias("plus_one")).show(5)

+---+--------+
| id|plus_one|
+---+--------+
|  0|       1|
|  1|       2|
|  2|       3|
|  3|       4|
|  4|       5|
+---+--------+
only showing top 5 rows
In [84]:
import pyspark.sql.functions as f

#     -  Python func
        #   , # ,    pd.Series
@f.pandas_udf(LongType(), PandasUDFType.SCALAR)
def plus_one(s):
      return s + 1

df.select("id", plus_one("id").alias("plus_one")).show(5)

+---+--------+
| id|plus_one|
+---+--------+
|  0|       1|
|  1|       2|
|  2|       3|
|  3|       4|
|  4|       5|
+---+--------+
only showing top 5 rows
In [85]:
import pyspark.sql.functions as f

@f.pandas_udf(LongType())
def plus_one(s):
      return s + 1

df.select("id", plus_one("id").alias("plus_one")).show(5)

+---+--------+
| id|plus_one|
+---+--------+
|  0|       1|
|  1|       2|
|  2|       3|
|  3|       4|
|  4|       5|
+---+--------+
only showing top 5 rows

pandas.Series - Spark, pandas_udf .

In [86]:
df
Out[86]:
DataFrame[id: bigint]
In [87]:
import pandas as pd
from scipy import stats

@pandas_udf(DoubleType())
def cdf(v: LongType()):
    return pd.Series(stats.norm.cdf(v))

df.withColumn('cumulative_probability', cdf(df.id)).show(3)

+---+----------------------+
| id|cumulative_probability|
+---+----------------------+
|  0|                   0.5|
|  1|    0.8413447460685429|
|  2|    0.9772498680518208|
+---+----------------------+
only showing top 3 rows
In [89]:
df = spark.createDataFrame(
    [(1, 1.0), (1, 2.0), (2, 3.0), (2, 5.0), (2, 10.0)],
    ("id", "v"))

df.show()

+---+----+
| id|   v|
+---+----+
|  1| 1.0|
|  1| 2.0|
|  2| 3.0|
|  2| 5.0|
|  2|10.0|
+---+----+
In [90]:
                    #     DataFrame
@pandas_udf(df.schema, PandasUDFType.GROUPED_MAP)                
def subtract_mean(pdf):
    return pdf.assign(v=pdf.v - pdf.v.mean())
In [74]:
df.groupby('id').apply(subtract_mean).show()

+---+----+
| id|   v|
+---+----+
|  1| 0.5|
|  1|-0.5|
|  2|-3.0|
|  2|-1.0|
|  2| 4.0|
+---+----+

Pandas UDF , UDF

Mixins¶

In [96]:
class Vehicle(object):
    
    def __init__(self, position):
        self.position = position
        print(position)
        
    def move_along(self):
        pass

    
class Car(Vehicle):
    pass


class Plane(Vehicle):
    pass
In [97]:
Car()

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-97-6398cfbfe55d> in <module>()
----> 1 Car()

TypeError: __init__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'position'
In [101]:
class Radio():
    
    def play_song(self):
        print("music")

class RadioMixin(object):
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.radio = Radio()
        print("radio")
    
    def play_song(self):
        self.radio.play_song()


class Car(Vehicle, RadioMixin):
    pass


class Clock(Vehicle, RadioMixin):
    pass
In [102]:
Car()

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-102-6398cfbfe55d> in <module>()
----> 1 Car()

TypeError: __init__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'position'

In [104]:
class Car(RadioMixin, Vehicle):
    pass

class Clock(RadioMixin, Vehicle):
    pass

car = Car()
car.play_song()

radio
music
In [105]:
class BaseClass1():
    def __init__(self): 
        print("BaseClass1")

class BaseClass2():
    def __init__(self): 
        print("BaseClass2")
    

class MyClass(BaseClass1, BaseClass2):
    def __init__(self): 
        super(MyClass, self).__init__()
In [106]:
my_class = MyClass()

BaseClass1
In [107]:
class BaseClass0():
    def __init__(self): 
        print("BaseClass0")

class BaseClass1(BaseClass0):
    pass

class BaseClass2():
    def __init__(self): 
        print("BaseClass2")
    
class MyClass(BaseClass1, BaseClass2):
    def __init__(self): 
        super(MyClass, self).__init__()
In [108]:
my_class = MyClass()

BaseClass0
In [109]:
class MyClass(BaseClass2, BaseClass1):
    def __init__(self): 
        super(MyClass, self).__init__()
In [110]:
my_class = MyClass()

BaseClass2

,

In [113]:
spark.stop()

Transformer base class

Estimator base class

Создадим базовый трансформатор¶

In [217]:
from pyspark.ml import Transformer
import pyspark.sql.functions as f
In [218]:
class ConstTransformer(Transformer):
    """Constant transformer.
    
    It just adds one constant column with a predefined name
    """
    #   
    def _transform(self, dataset):
                                            #     
        return dataset.withColumn("mytransformer", f.lit("I am a constant"))
In [219]:
df = spark.range(0, 10, numPartitions=1)

|  1|

+---+
only showing top 3 rows

Как специфицируются параметры transformer'а?¶

HasOutputCol mixin

In [225]:
from pyspark.ml.param.shared import HasOutputCol
In [226]:
class ConstTransformer(Transformer, HasOutputCol):
    """Constant transformer with variable name."""
    
    def __init__(self): 
        super(ConstTransformer, self).__init__()
        
    def _transform(self, dataset):
        return dataset.withColumn(self.getOutputCol(), f.lit("I am a constant"))
In [227]:
transformer = ConstTransformer()
In [228]:
transformer.extractParamMap()
Out[228]:
{Param(parent='ConstTransformer_5394274356e8', name='outputCol', doc='output column name.'): 'ConstTransformer_5394274356e8__output'}
In [229]:
transformer.getOutputCol()
Out[229]:
'ConstTransformer_5394274356e8__output'
In [230]:
transformer.transform(df).show()

+---+-------------------------------------+
| id|ConstTransformer_5394274356e8__output|
+---+-------------------------------------+
|  0|                      I am a constant|
|  1|                      I am a constant|
|  2|                      I am a constant|
|  3|                      I am a constant|
|  4|                      I am a constant|
|  5|                      I am a constant|
|  6|                      I am a constant|
|  7|                      I am a constant|
|  8|                      I am a constant|
|  9|                      I am a constant|
+---+-------------------------------------+
In [231]:
transformer.setOutputCol("lalalalala")
Out[231]:
ConstTransformer_5394274356e8

| id|     lalalalala|
+---+---------------+
|  0|I am a constant|
|  1|I am a constant|
|  2|I am a constant|
|  3|I am a constant|
|  4|I am a constant|
|  5|I am a constant|
|  6|I am a constant|
|  7|I am a constant|
|  8|I am a constant|
|  9|I am a constant|
+---+---------------+
In [233]:
from pyspark import keyword_only
In [234]:
class ConstTransformer(Transformer, HasOutputCol):
    
    # ,      
    @keyword_only
    def __init__(self, outputCol=None):
        
        super(ConstTransformer, self).__init__()
        
        if outputCol is not None:
            self.setOutputCol(outputCol)
        
    def _transform(self, dataset):
        return dataset.withColumn(self.getOutputCol(), f.lit("I am a constant"))
In [235]:
transformer = ConstTransformer("mycolumn")

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-235-00ea2c999399> in <module>()
----> 1 transformer = ConstTransformer("mycolumn")

    106     def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs):
    107         if len(args) > 0:
--> 108             raise TypeError("Method %s forces keyword arguments." % func.__name__)
    109         self._input_kwargs = kwargs
    110         return func(self, **kwargs)

Давайте создадим transformer с заданными input и output колонками?¶

HasInputCol mixin

In [241]:
from pyspark.ml.param.shared import HasInputCol
In [242]:
class HashTransformer(Transformer, HasInputCol, HasOutputCol):
    
    @keyword_only
    def __init__(self, inputCol=None, outputCol=None):
        super(HashTransformer, self).__init__()
        if inputCol is not None:
            self.setInputCol(inputCol)
        if outputCol is not None:
            self.setOutputCol(outputCol)
            
    def _transform(self, dataset):
                                         # -,     md5 
                                            ##  f.col      ,   , 
                                              ###    string
        return dataset.withColumn(self.getOutputCol(), f.md5(f.col(self.getInputCol()).cast("string")))
In [243]:
transformer = HashTransformer(inputCol="id", outputCol="hash")
In [244]:
transformer.transform(df).show(5, False, True)

-RECORD 0--------------------------------
 id   | 0                                
 hash | cfcd208495d565ef66e7dff9f98764da 
-RECORD 1--------------------------------
 id   | 1                                
 hash | c4ca4238a0b923820dcc509a6f75849b 
-RECORD 2--------------------------------
 id   | 2                                
 hash | c81e728d9d4c2f636f067f89cc14862c 
-RECORD 3--------------------------------
 id   | 3                                
 hash | eccbc87e4b5ce2fe28308fd9f2a7baf3 
-RECORD 4--------------------------------
 id   | 4                                
 hash | a87ff679a2f3e71d9181a67b7542122c 
only showing top 5 rows

Как определить кастомный параметр?¶

Param

In [245]:
from pyspark.ml.param import Param, Params, TypeConverters
In [246]:
class HashTransformer(Transformer, HasInputCol, HasOutputCol):
                                        #   # 
    algorithm = Param(Params._dummy(), 'algorithm', 'hash function to use, must be one of (md5|sha1)',
                     typeConverter=TypeConverters.toString)
    
    @keyword_only
    def __init__(self, inputCol=None, outputCol=None, algorithm='md5'):
        super(HashTransformer, self).__init__()
        
        if inputCol is not None:
            self.setInputCol(inputCol)
            
        if outputCol is not None:
            self.setOutputCol(outputCol)
            
        self._set(algorithm=algorithm)
    
    
    def get_has_function(self):
        """
            
        """
        try:
            return getattr(f, self.getOrDefault('algorithm'))
        
        except:
            raise ValueError('Unsupported algo {}'.format(self.getOrDefault('algorithm')))
            
    def setAlgoritm(self, algorithm):
        self._set(algorithm=algorithm)
        
    def _transform(self, dataset):
        hash_col_func = self.get_has_function()
        return dataset.withColumn(self.getOutputCol(), hash_col_func(f.col(self.getInputCol()).cast('string')))
In [247]:
transformer = HashTransformer(inputCol='id', outputCol='hash', algorithm='lalal')
In [248]:
transformer.explainParams()
Out[248]:
'algorithm: hash function to use, must be one of (md5|sha1) (current: lalal)\ninputCol: input column name. (current: id)\noutputCol: output column name. (default: HashTransformer_7e87b67ff91e__output, current: hash)'
In [249]:
transformer.getOrDefault('algorithm')
Out[249]:
'lalal'
In [250]:
transformer.transform(df).show()

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

     23         try:
---> 24             return getattr(f, self.getOrDefault('algorithm'))
     25

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

<ipython-input-250-34854416eae7> in <module>()
----> 1 transformer.transform(df).show()

/usr/hdp/current/spark2-client/python/pyspark/ml/base.py in transform(self, dataset, params)
    171                 return self.copy(params)._transform(dataset)
    172             else:
--> 173                 return self._transform(dataset)
    174         else:
    175             raise ValueError("Params must be a param map but got %s." % type(params))

<ipython-input-246-f51e910cabc8> in _transform(self, dataset)
     31

---> 33         hash_col_func = self.get_has_function()
     34         return dataset.withColumn(self.getOutputCol(), hash_col_func(f.col(self.getInputCol()).cast('string')))
     35 

<ipython-input-246-f51e910cabc8> in get_has_function(self)
     25 
     26         except:
---> 27             raise ValueError('Unsupported algo {}'.format(self.getOrDefault('algorithm')))
     28

|  9|0ade7c2cf97f75d00...|
+---+--------------------+

Передадим параметр из одного Transformer'а в другой¶

In [254]:
class HashTransformer(Transformer, HasInputCol, HasOutputCol):
    
    algorithm = Param(Params._dummy(), "algorithm",
                      "hash function to use, must be one of (md5|sha1)",
                      typeConverter=TypeConverters.toString)
    
    @keyword_only
    def __init__(self, inputCol=None, outputCol=None, algorithm="md5"):
        super(HashTransformer, self).__init__()
        if inputCol is not None:
            self.setInputCol(inputCol)
        if outputCol is not None:
            self.setOutputCol(outputCol)
        self._set(algorithm=algorithm)
        
    def get_hash_function(self):
        try:
            return getattr(f, self.getOrDefault("algorithm"))
        except AttributeError as e:
            raise ValueError("Unsupported algorithm {}".format(self.getOrDefault("algorithm")))
            
    def setAlgorithm(self, algorithm):
        self._set(algorithm=algorithm)
    
    def getAlgorithm(self):
        return self.getOrDefault("algorithm")

    def _transform(self, dataset):
        hash_col = self.get_hash_function()
        res = dataset.withColumn(self.getOutputCol(), hash_col(f.col(self.getInputCol()).cast("string")))
        return res
In [255]:
transformer1 = HashTransformer(inputCol="id", 
                               outputCol="hash1", 
                               algorithm="sha1")

transformer2 = HashTransformer(inputCol=transformer1.getOutputCol(), 
                               outputCol="hash2", 
                               algorithm=transformer1.getAlgorithm())
In [256]:
transformer2.getAlgorithm()
Out[256]:
'sha1'
In [257]:
from pyspark.ml import Pipeline

pipeline = Pipeline(stages=[transformer1, transformer2])
In [259]:
pipeline_model = pipeline.fit(df)
In [260]:
pipeline_model.transform(df).show(5)

+---+--------------------+--------------------+
| id|               hash1|               hash2|
+---+--------------------+--------------------+
|  0|b6589fc6ab0dc82cf...|784a97bf1955d5f7a...|
|  1|356a192b7913b04c5...|9c1c01dc3ac1445a5...|
|  2|da4b9237bacccdf19...|f4f59e822581d785b...|

In [25]:
import os
import sys
os.environ["PYSPARK_SUBMIT_ARGS"]='pyspark-shell'
os.environ["PYSPARK_PYTHON"]='/opt/anaconda/envs/bd9/bin/python'
os.environ["SPARK_HOME"]='/usr/hdp/current/spark2-client'

spark_home = os.environ.get('SPARK_HOME', None)
if not spark_home:
    raise ValueError('SPARK_HOME environment variable is not set')
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python'))
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python/lib/py4j-0.10.7-src.zip'))

from pyspark import SparkConf
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

conf = SparkConf()
conf.set("spark.app.name", "app")

spark = SparkSession.builder.config(conf=conf).getOrCreate()

from pyspark.ml import Estimator
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.datasets import make_classification
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

from pyspark.ml.linalg import DenseVector, VectorUDT
from pyspark.sql.types import StructField, StructType, IntegerType, FloatType, ArrayType
import pyspark.sql.functions as f
In [52]:

Out[53]:
(100,)

Out[55]:

          penalty='l2', random_state=5757, solver='liblinear', tol=0.0001,
          verbose=0, warm_start=False)

@f.pandas_udf(FloatType())
def predict(series):
    predictions = est_broadcast.value.predict(series)
    return pd.Series(predictions)

@f.udf(ArrayType(FloatType()))
def vectorToArray(row):
    return DenseVector(row).tolist()

df_test = df_test.withColumn('features_array', vectorToArray('features'))

In [89]:
@f.pandas_udf(FloatType())
def predict(series):
    #  , .   pd.Series((list1, list2))
    print(series)
    predictions = est_broadcast.value.predict(series.tolist())
    return pd.Series(predictions)

In [90]:
import pickle

with open('logistic_model.pk', 'wb') as f:

, Spark,

Model base class

In [91]:
from pyspark import keyword_only
from pyspark.ml import Model, Estimator
from pyspark.ml.param import Param, Params, TypeConverters
from pyspark.ml.param.shared import HasFeaturesCol, HasLabelCol, HasPredictionCol
In [105]:
class SKLogisticRegreesionModel(Model, HasFeaturesCol, HasLabelCol, HasPredictionCol):
    """
      
    """
    
    model_file = Param(Params._dummy(), "model_file",
                      "path to pickled scikit-learn logistic regression model",
                      typeConverter=TypeConverters.toString)
    @keyword_only
    def __init__(self, model_file=None, featuresCol="features", labelCol="label", predictionCol="prediction"):
        super(SKLogisticRegreesionModel, self).__init__()
        
        if model_file is None:
            raise ValueError("model_file must be specified!")
            
        with open(model_file, "rb") as f:
            self.estimator = pickle.load(f)
            
        kwargs = self._input_kwargs
        self._set(**kwargs)
        
    def _transform(self, dataset):
        return dataset.withColumn(self.getPredictionCol(), predict(self.getFeaturesCol()))
In [106]:
spark_est = SKLogisticRegreesionModel(model_file='logistic_model.pk', featuresCol='features_array')
In [110]:
spark_est.explainParams()
Out[110]:
'featuresCol: features column name. (default: features, current: features_array)\nlabelCol: label column name. (default: label)\nmodel_file: path to pickled scikit-learn logistic regression model (current: logistic_model.pk)\npredictionCol: prediction column name. (default: prediction)'
In [112]:
spark_est.params
Out[112]:
[Param(parent='SKLogisticRegreesionModel_c871345da32c', name='featuresCol', doc='features column name.'),
 Param(parent='SKLogisticRegreesionModel_c871345da32c', name='labelCol', doc='label column name.'),
 Param(parent='SKLogisticRegreesionModel_c871345da32c', name='model_file', doc='path to pickled scikit-learn logistic regression model'),
 Param(parent='SKLogisticRegreesionModel_c871345da32c', name='predictionCol', doc='prediction column name.')]

Estimator base class

In [124]:
class SKLogisticRegression(Estimator, HasFeaturesCol, HasPredictionCol, HasLabelCol):
    
    @keyword_only
    def __init__(self, featuresCol="features", predictionCol="prediction", labelCol="label"):
        super(SKLogisticRegression, self).__init__()
        kwargs = self._input_kwargs
        self._set(**kwargs)
        
    def _fit(self, dataset):
        """
        repartion(1),        
            
           - >  
        
             ,  Spark   feature_eng,  -  
        """ 
        # toPandas() ->   sklearn,            #    Sparka 
        local_dataset = dataset.select(self.getFeaturesCol(), self.getLabelCol()).toPandas()
        self.est = LogisticRegression()
        self.est.fit(local_dataset[self.getFeaturesCol()].tolist(), local_dataset[self.getLabelCol()])
        self.model_file = "logistic_regression.pk"
        with open(self.model_file, "wb") as f:
            pickle.dump(self.est, f)
        return SKLogisticRegreesionModel(model_file=self.model_file, predictionCol=self.getPredictionCol(),
                                         featuresCol=self.getFeaturesCol(), labelCol=self.getLabelCol())
In [125]:
spark_est = SKLogisticRegression(featuresCol="features_array")
In [126]:
spark_est_model = spark_est.fit(df_test)
In [127]:

|[2.50158633810562...|    0|[2.5015864, 1.394...|       0.0|
|[-0.7699917522248...|    0|[-0.76999176, 0.1...|       0.0|

only showing top 3 rows

In [190]:
import os
import sys
os.environ["PYSPARK_SUBMIT_ARGS"]='--num-executors 3 pyspark-shell'
os.environ["PYSPARK_PYTHON"]='/opt/anaconda/envs/bd9/bin/python'
os.environ["SPARK_HOME"]='/usr/hdp/current/spark2-client'

spark_home = os.environ.get('SPARK_HOME', None)
if not spark_home:
    raise ValueError('SPARK_HOME environment variable is not set')
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python'))
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(spark_home, 'python/lib/py4j-0.10.7-src.zip'))

from pyspark import SparkConf
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

conf = SparkConf()
conf.set("spark.app.name", "app")

spark = SparkSession.builder.config(conf=conf).getOrCreate()

import pandas as pd

In [192]:
pdf = pd.read_csv("diamonds.csv", header=0).iloc[:,1:]
pdf.head()
Out[192]:
carat cut color clarity depth table price x y z
0 0.23 Ideal E SI2 61.5 55.0 326 3.95 3.98 2.43
1 0.21 Premium E SI1 59.8 61.0 326 3.89 3.84 2.31
2 0.23 Good E VS1 56.9 65.0 327 4.05 4.07 2.31
3 0.29 Premium I VS2 62.4 58.0 334 4.20 4.23 2.63

Feature engineering¶

In [193]:
pdf['cut'] = pdf['cut'].replace({'Fair': 0, 'Good': 1, 'Very Good': 2, 'Premium': 3, 'Ideal': 4})
pdf['color'] = pdf['color'].replace({'J': 0, 'I': 1, 'H': 2, 'G': 3, 'F': 4, 'E': 5, 'D': 6})
pdf['clarity'] = pdf['clarity'].replace({'I1': 0, 'SI1': 1, 'SI2': 2, 'VS1': 3, 'VS2': 4, 'VVS1': 5, 'VVS2': 6, 'IF': 7})
pdf.head()
Out[193]:
carat cut color clarity depth table price x y z
0 0.23 4 5 2 61.5 55.0 326 3.95 3.98 2.43
1 0.21 3 5 1 59.8 61.0 326 3.89 3.84 2.31

Parameter tuning со Spark¶

Parameter tuning - () ML . ( ) , , .

k-fold cross validation:

  • ("folds")

    • i = 1, 2, ..., k, i validation set.

    • training set - i

    • , k validation set, ,

(fold, parameter set) . : scikit-learn executor'. , - ML workflow.

k P , - ?

Отложим random test set¶

In [238]:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

trainingLabels, testLabels, trainingFeatures, testFeatures = train_test_split(labels, features, test_size=0.2)
ntrain, ntest = len(trainingLabels), len(testLabels)
print('Split data randomly into 2 sets: %d training and %d test instances.' % (ntrain, ntest))

Split data randomly into 2 sets: 43152 training and 10788 test instances.

Разобьем данные и определим таски, которые будем параллелизировать¶

- (fold, parameter set) pair.

In [239]:
from sklearn.model_selection import KFold
numFolds = 5 # more (10 or so) in practice
kf = KFold(n_splits=numFolds)
In [240]:
for trainIndex_, valIndex_  in kf.split(trainingFeatures):
    print("Shape train " + str(trainingFeatures[trainIndex_].shape))
    print("Shape val " +  str(trainingFeatures[valIndex_].shape))

Shape train (34521, 9)
Shape val (8631, 9)
Shape train (34521, 9)
Shape val (8631, 9)
Shape train (34522, 9)
Shape val (8630, 9)
Shape train (34522, 9)
Shape val (8630, 9)
Shape train (34522, 9)
Shape val (8630, 9)
In [241]:
alphas = [0.0, 0.0001, 0.001, 0.01, 0.1, 1.0, 10.0, 100.0, 1000.0]
tasks = []
for alpha in alphas:
    for fold in range(numFolds):
        tasks = tasks + [(alpha, fold)]
In [242]:
tasks[:3], len(tasks)
Out[242]:
([(0.0, 0), (0.0, 1), (0.0, 2)], 45)
In [243]:
sc = spark.sparkContext

tasksRDD = sc.parallelize(tasks, numSlices = len(tasks))
In [244]:
#     -   
trainingFeaturesBroadcast = sc.broadcast(trainingFeatures)
trainingLabelsBroadcast = sc.broadcast(trainingLabels)

Запустим параллельную cross-validation¶

, worker'e, (1 hyperparameter alpha value + 1 fold index) . RDD.map .

In [245]:
from sklearn import linear_model

def trainOneModel(alpha, fold):
    """
    Given 1 task (1 hyperparameter alpha value + 1 fold index), 
    train the corresponding model.
    
    Return: model, score on the fold's test data, task info.
    """
    localTrainingFeatures = trainingFeaturesBroadcast.value
    localTrainingLabels = trainingLabelsBroadcast.value
    trainIndex, valIndex = [], []
    fold_ = 0 
    
    for trainIndex_, valIndex_ in kf.split(localTrainingFeatures):
        if fold_ == fold:
            trainIndex, valIndex = trainIndex_, valIndex_
            break
        fold_ += 1
    X_train, X_val = localTrainingFeatures[trainIndex], localTrainingFeatures[valIndex]
    Y_train, Y_val = localTrainingLabels[trainIndex], localTrainingLabels[valIndex]

    clf = linear_model.Ridge(alpha=alpha)
    clf.fit(X_train, Y_train)
    score = clf.score(X_val, Y_val)
    return clf, score, alpha, fold
In [246]:
%%time
trainedModelAndScores = tasksRDD.map(lambda alpha_fold: trainOneModel(alpha_fold[0], alpha_fold[1]))
trainedModelAndScores.cache()
trainedModelAndScores.count()

CPU times: user 10.4 ms, sys: 4.15 ms, total: 14.6 ms
Wall time: 4.1 s
In [247]:
trainingFeaturesBroadcast.unpersist()
trainingLabelsBroadcast.unpersist()

Соберем результаты для лучшей hyperparameter alpha¶

In [248]:
allScores = trainedModelAndScores.map(lambda x: (x[1], x[2], x[3])).collect()
avgScores = dict(map(lambda alpha: (alpha, 0.0), alphas))

In [250]:
for score, alpha, fold in allScores:
    avgScores[alpha] += score
for alpha in alphas:
    avgScores[alpha] /= numFolds
avgScores

In [251]:
# Find best score
bestAlpha = -1
bestScore = -1
for alpha in alphas:
    if avgScores[alpha] > bestScore:
        bestAlpha = alpha
        bestScore = avgScores[alpha]
print('Found best alpha: %g, which gives score: %g' % (bestAlpha, bestScore))

Found best alpha: 0, which gives score: 0.893806

Обучим финальную модель с лучшим набором гиперпараметров¶

1 , .

tunedClf = linear_model.Ridge(alpha=bestAlpha)
tunedClf.fit(trainingFeatures, trainingLabels)

Обработка логов безопасности¶

  • OLAP

Виды стриминг систем¶

Real-time streaming¶

  • OLTP
  • exactly once consistency ( )

Micro batch streaming - Spark подойдет¶

  • OLAP
  • at least once consistency ( )

Выводы:¶

  • - real-time micro-batch
  • Spark Structured Streaming micro-batch
  • ,

In [180]:
#   -  
#     

def create_console_sink(df):
    """
    format("console") -   =  
    trigger(processingTime="5 seconds") -      = 5 sec
    """
    return df \
            .writeStream \
            .format("console") \
            .trigger(processingTime="5 seconds") \
            .option("truncate", "false") \
            .option("numRows", "20")
In [84]:

, . checkpoints

In [181]:
def kill_all():
    """
      Spark Streamo
      Stream  
    """
    streams = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate().streams.active
    if streams:
        for s in streams:
            try:
                desc = s.lastProgress["sources"][0]["description"]
            except Exception as e:
                desc = None
            s.stop()
            print("Stopped {s}".format(s=desc))
In [91]:
kill_all()

Stopped RateSource[rowsPerSecond=1, rampUpTimeSeconds=0, numPartitions=2]

In [92]:
SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate().streams.active
Out[92]:
[]

, parquet :

In [105]:
def create_parquet_sink(df, file_name):
    
    """
        parquet
    """
    return df \
            .repartition(1) \
            .writeStream \
            .format("parquet") \
            .option("path", "/tmp/output/{f}".format(f=file_name)) \
            .option("checkpointLocation", "/tmp/chk/{f}".format(f=file_name)) \
            .trigger(processingTime="10 seconds")\
            .option("numRows", "20")
In [106]:
sink = create_parquet_sink(sdf, "s1.parquet")
sink

<pyspark.sql.streaming.DataStreamWriter at 0x7fd2330d8780>

from pyspark.sql.functions import rand, array, lit #shuffle

idents_cols = [lit(i) for i in idents]
print(idents_cols[:3], len(idents_cols), type(idents_cols), type(idents_cols[1]), sep=' || ')

print('======')

idents_array = array(*idents_cols)
print(type(idents_array), type(idents_array[0]), sep=' || ')

#shuffled = shuffle(idents_array)
rand_ident = idents_array[0]

print(rand_ident)

ident_sdf = sdf.withColumn("ident", rand_ident)

                    .readStream \
                    .format("parquet") \

                    .option("path", "/tmp/output/s2.parquet") \
                    .load()

In [132]:
from pyspark.sql.functions import lower

sdf_from_parquet = spark \
                    .readStream \
                    .format("parquet") \
                    .schema(ident_pq.schema) \
                    .option("maxFilesPerTrigger", "1") \
                    .option("path", "/tmp/output/s2.parquet") \
                    .load() \
                    .withColumn("ident", lower(col("ident")))

sdf_from_parquet.printSchema()

Spark connector¶

Запуск Kafka в docker¶

docker run --rm \
   -p 2181:2181 \
   --name=test_zoo \
   -e ZOOKEEPER_CLIENT_PORT=2181 \
   confluentinc/cp-zookeeper

docker run --rm \
    -p 9092:9092 \
    --name=test_kafka \
    -e KAFKA_ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT=host.docker.internal:2181 \
    -e KAFKA_ADVERTISED_LISTENERS=PLAINTEXT://host.docker.internal:9092 \
    -e KAFKA_OFFSETS_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR=1 \
    confluentinc/cp-kafka

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, min, max, lit
In [137]:
ident_pq = spark.read.parquet("/tmp/output/s2.parquet")
ident_pq.select(max(col('timestamp'))).show(3, False, True)
ident_pq.select(min(col('timestamp'))).show(3, False, True)

print(ident_pq.count())
ident_pq.printSchema()

|timestamp             |value|ident|

|2022-11-10 01:26:20.05|9    |00A  |
|2022-11-10 01:26:21.05|10   |00A  |

|2022-11-10 01:26:23.05|12   |00A  |

only showing top 5 rows
In [138]:
from pyspark.sql.functions import struct, to_json

def write_kafka(topic, data):
    """
        Kafka
    """
                    #    
    #kafka_params = {"kafka.bootstrap.servers": "localhost:9092"}
    kafka_params = {"kafka.bootstrap.servers": "spark-node-1.newprolab.com:6667"}
    

    
    #  DataFrame
    kafka_doc = to_json(struct(col("*")))
    raw = data \
        .select(kafka_doc.alias("value")) \
        .withColumn("topic", lit(topic))
    
    raw.show(5, False)
    
    raw.write.format("kafka") \
        .options(**kafka_params).save()
In [144]:
ident_pq
Out[144]:

In [148]:
kafka_params = {
    "kafka.bootstrap.servers": "spark-node-1.newprolab.com:6667",
    #     
    "subscribe": "test_topic00, test_topic01, test_topic02"
}

df = spark.read.format("kafka").options(**kafka_params).load()

df.printSchema()
df.show()

print(df.count())

df.groupBy(col("topic"), col("partition")).count().show()

In [166]:
kafka_params = {
    "kafka.bootstrap.servers": "spark-node-1.newprolab.com:6667",
    #     
    "subscribe": "test_topic00, test_topic01, test_topic02",
    "startingOffsets": """ { "test_topic00": { "0": 4 },"test_topic01": { "0": 5 },"test_topic02": { "0": 6 } } """,
    "endingOffsets": """ { "test_topic00": { "0": 7 },"test_topic01": { "0": 8 },"test_topic02": { "0": 10 } }  """
}


df = spark.read.format("kafka").options(**kafka_params).load()

df.printSchema()
df.show(20)

Работа с Kafka с помощью Streaming DF - 99% кейсов на работе¶

SDF Kafka , :

  • startingOffsets latest
  • endingOffsets
  • ( ) maxOffsetPerTrigger (
In [176]:
kill_all()
In [191]:
kafka_params = {
    "kafka.bootstrap.servers": "spark-node-1.newprolab.com:6667",
#     
    "subscribe": "test_topic00, test_topic01, test_topic02",
    "startingOffsets": """earliest""", # endingOffsets ,  
# .  ,       -  !!!     
    "maxOffsetsPerTrigger": "5",
#     
    "minPartitions": "10"
}

sdf = spark.readStream.format("kafka").options(**kafka_params).load()
parsed_sdf = sdf.select(col("value").cast("string"), col("topic"), col("partition"), col("offset"))

sink = create_console_sink(parsed_sdf)

sq = sink.start()

In [192]:
SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate().streams.active
Out[192]:
[<pyspark.sql.streaming.StreamingQuery at 0x7fd233022390>]
In [193]:
kill_all()

Stopped None

, . , checkpointLocation writeStream:

In [204]:
def create_console_sink_with_checkpoint(chk_name, df): 
    return df \
        .writeStream \
        .format("console") \
        .trigger(processingTime="10 seconds") \
        .option("checkpointLocation", "/tmp/chk/{n}".format(n=chk_name)) \
        .option("truncate", "false") \
        .option("numRows", "20")
In [217]:
sink = create_console_sink_with_checkpoint("test0", parsed_sdf)
sq = sink.start()
In [218]:
SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate().streams.active
Out[218]:
[]

In [ ]:
